title: 115_hr430
content: The "State Sponsors of Terrorism Review Enhancement Act" is the short title of the Act. It includes modifications to authorities that allow for the rescission of determinations of countries as state sponsors of terrorism. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to extend the time period for certain actions and disapprove rescissions under specific conditions. No rescission can be made if Congress enacts a joint resolution within 90 days after receiving a report. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to extend the time period for certain actions and disapprove rescissions under specific conditions. A new subsection is added requiring notification to Congress within 10 days of initiating a review of a country's activities. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to extend the time period for certain actions and disapprove rescissions under specific conditions. The Arms Export Control Act is also amended to extend the time period for notifications to Congress from 45 days to 90 days and from a 6-month period to a 24-month period. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to extend time periods for actions and disapprove rescissions under specific conditions. The Arms Export Control Act is also amended to extend notification periods to Congress from 45 days to 90 days and from 6 months to 24 months. Additionally, subsections are redesignated and new notification and briefing requirements are introduced. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 and the Arms Export Control Act are amended to extend notification periods to Congress. The Export Administration Act of 1979 is also amended to increase the briefing period to 90 days. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 and the Arms Export Control Act are amended to extend notification periods to Congress. The Export Administration Act of 1979 is also amended to increase the briefing period to 90 days. Additionally, amendments include changing the time period from a 6-month to a 24-month period and adding new paragraphs regarding disapproval of rescission and notification requirements. The President must notify Congress within 10 days of initiating a review of a country's activities and brief them within 20 days. The Export Administration Regulations will be amended as necessary.
